Approved Language: Contract is signed and FC has a 24-hour decision owner through March 16.
Avoid Saying: Execution is blocked by contract or slow decisions.
Business Impact: Reduces delivery risk during milestone weeks.

Approved Language: MVP runs on Vercel + Supabase.
Avoid Saying: We must wait for FC-hosted infrastructure before launch.
Business Impact: Team can build now and migrate later if needed.

Approved Language: USPS sends participant cohort welcome email with coach-selector link; participants enter roster-matched email only in MVP (no participant access codes and no CIL participant emails).
Avoid Saying: Participant OTP emails or individual participant access codes are required from CIL in MVP.
Business Impact: Fits USPS group-send workflow and FC sender constraints while keeping MVP launch scope intact.

Approved Language: Coaches and admins use /auth/signin and request a new magic link when needed.
Avoid Saying: Old magic-link emails should be reused forever.
Business Impact: Low-friction sign-in with clear repeat-login behavior.

Approved Language: Separate pools: 15 coaches for MLP/ALP and 16 for EF/EL; no cross-pool matching in MVP.
Avoid Saying: All programs share one coach pool.
Business Impact: Matches FC operating model and avoids assignment drift.

Approved Language: Coaches log outcomes; no automatic Session 1 expiry in MVP. Forfeiture labels are locked in approved language.
Avoid Saying: System auto-forfeits sessions by deadline in MVP.
Business Impact: Keeps policy controlled by coaches/ops and language consistent in reporting.

Approved Language: Day 0 = cohortStartDate for selection-window timing logic.
Avoid Saying: Selection timing runs from invitation date or first login.
Business Impact: Keeps cohort-based timing consistent across imports and tracking.

Approved Language: Coach load counts assigned and active/paused participants; invited, completed, and canceled do not count.
Avoid Saying: Invited-only or completed/canceled participants consume capacity.
Business Impact: Prevents overcounting and keeps assignment logic consistent.

Approved Language: EF/EL coach capacity is confirmed at 20 participants per coach.
Avoid Saying: EF/EL capacity is still 15 or still pending.
Business Impact: Locks assignment logic and load-test assumptions for EF/EL cohorts.

Approved Language: Planning baseline is 400 total participants across MVP cohorts.
Avoid Saying: Participant total is unknown for planning.
Business Impact: Stabilizes database sizing and capacity validation assumptions.

Approved Language: EF/EL reporting window is coach-selection-window start + 9 months.
Avoid Saying: EF/EL reporting anchor is still undecided.
Business Impact: Keeps cross-cohort reporting and deadline flagging consistent.

Approved Language: Staging and production run in separate Vercel and Supabase projects with separate secrets.
Avoid Saying: One shared environment is fine for MVP.
Business Impact: Reduces deployment and data-leak risk during launch period.

Approved Language: Staging uses controlled data handling (sanitized-by-default for non-launch QA) plus sandboxed email mode, hard allowlist, and outbound kill switch (EMAIL_OUTBOUND_ENABLED=false).
Avoid Saying: Staging can use unrestricted outbound sends or bypass email guard checks.
Business Impact: Prevents accidental external sends while allowing launch-realistic staging validation when needed.

Approved Language: Use Vercel Pro + Supabase Pro for MVP launch window.
Avoid Saying: Hobby/free tiers are sufficient for production launch.
Business Impact: Improves reliability, support posture, and backup/log safety for client delivery.

Approved Language: Coach booking links are tool-agnostic for MVP: Calendly, Acuity, or equivalent direct booking URLs are accepted.
Avoid Saying: Calendly is mandatory for every coach.
Business Impact: Reduces onboarding delay and keeps March 2 launch path viable.

Approved Language: Coaches without active booking links may still be selected; confirmation shows coach-outreach fallback messaging and needs-attention monitoring.
Avoid Saying: Hide coaches from selection when booking links are missing.
Business Impact: Keeps selection breadth high while preserving a clear fallback path.

Approved Language: Coach bio videos are de-scoped from MVP coach selector.
Avoid Saying: Coach selector MVP includes video bios.
Business Impact: Reduces content dependency and launch risk for March timeline.

Approved Language: Participant detail spreadsheets (for example FY26 ALP 136_EF 1 Coaching Bios.xlsx) are post-MVP and are not integrated into coach selector/matching logic for March launch.
Avoid Saying: Participant context spreadsheets are part of coach selector matching in MVP.
Business Impact: Protects launch timeline and preserves this as a Phase 2 coach-context enhancement.

Approved Language: ALP-138 Session 2 starts Aug 7, 2026.
Avoid Saying: Session 2 starts Aug 4 2026.
Business Impact: Aligns timeline logic with in-person Week 2 end date.

Approved Language: USPS sends participant welcome communication on the first day of each coach-selection window.
Avoid Saying: FC/CIL sends participant welcome messages by default.
Business Impact: Clarifies handoff and timing ownership for launch execution.

Approved Language: Andrea and/or Kari send coach access instructions as soon as portal is available and before Mar 2.
Avoid Saying: Coaches wait until Mar 2 to receive access details.
Business Impact: Reduces coach onboarding risk before launch.

Approved Language: Manual handling only for ALP/MLP in MVP: no automatic lock/forfeit and use dashboard Needs Attention for ops follow-up. EF/EL does not use this model.
Avoid Saying: System automatically closes/forfeits sessions at deadline for all programs.
Business Impact: Keeps status control with coaches/ops and avoids false forfeits in mixed program timelines.

Approved Language: All system send paths must call shared guard helpers before provider send (src/lib/email/guard.ts, src/lib/email/send-with-guard.ts).
Avoid Saying: Ad-hoc send calls without centralized safety checks.
Business Impact: Creates one enforceable control point for staging/prod email behavior.

Approved Language: Schema is multi-org ready now (single DB, strict org scoping, coach multi-org membership). USPS is the initial seeded org.
Avoid Saying: MVP schema is USPS-only and requires redesign before onboarding another organization.
Business Impact: Reduces Phase 2 platform expansion risk after USPS MVP launch.
